hints.content:
The number line shows $\maroonD{4}$ equal jumps of $\blueD{9}$ units.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled, plus 9](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b632ed80978e6ccff643917b579908b6ec2a8fb6)

options.explanation:
$\maroonD{4}\times\blueD{9}=\maroonD{4}\blueD{\text{ nines}}$.

That's the same as $\maroonD{2}\blueD{\text{ nines}}+\maroonD{2}\blueD{\text{ nines}}$.

![The same number line with a brace spanning the first 2 arrows labeled, 2 nines, and a brace spanning the other 2 arrows labeled, 2 nines](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c895b8e0d41256467bf0865e99276d563b512841)

$\redD{18}+\purpleC{18}=\greenD{36}$

So $\maroonD{4}\times\blueD{9}=\greenD{36}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the number line below to help solve the equation.* 

$4 \times 9 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]
